info.name: Phone-Book-App
info.description: Welcome to the documentation for the Phone Book App CRUD API. This API provides endpoints for managing user authentication and products.

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
This endpoint is used to authenticate a user and obtain a token for accessing protected resources.

### Request Body

- `email` (string, required): The email of the user.
    
- `password` (string, required): The password of the user.
    

### Response

Upon a successful request, the response will include:

- `email` (string): The email of the authenticated user.
    
- `token` (string): The authentication token to be used for accessing protected resources.
    

In case of an unsuccessful request, appropriate error responses will be returned.

This endpoint allows users to register with the application by sending a POST request to the specified URL. The request should include a JSON payload in the raw request body type, containing the "username" and "password" fields.

### Request Body

- `username` (string): The username of the user.
- `password` (string): The password chosen by the user.
    

### Response

Upon successful registration, the server responds with a JSON object containing the "username" of the registered user and a "token" for authentication.

Example:

``` json
{
    "username": "",
    "token": ""
}

 ```

item.description: Authenticate a user and generate a token.

item.name: User Management

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the contacts of a user. The response will be in JSON format and will include the contact details such as id, full name, phone number, email, image, user ID, creation timestamp, and last update timestamp.

The response will contain an array of contact objects, where each object represents a contact with its respective details.

Example response:

``` json
[
    {
        "id": 0,
        "fullName": "",
        "phoneNumber": "",
        "email": "",
        "image": "",
        "UserId": 0,
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": ""
    }
]

 ```

item.description: Retrieve contacts associated with the authenticated user.

item.name: Contact Management

request.description:
This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the contact information for a specific contact with ID 2. The response will be in JSON format and will include the contact's ID, full name, phone number, email, image, user ID, creation timestamp, and last update timestamp.

### Response

- `id` (number): The unique identifier of the contact.
- `fullName` (string): The full name of the contact.
- `phoneNumber` (string): The phone number of the contact.
- `email` (string): The email address of the contact.
- `image` (string): The URL or path to the contact's image.
- `UserId` (number): The unique identifier of the user associated with the contact.
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the contact was created.
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the contact was last updated.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "id": 0,
    "fullName": "",
    "phoneNumber": "",
    "email": "",
    "image": "",
    "UserId": 0,
    "createdAt": "",
    "updatedAt": ""
}

 ```

This endpoint allows you to create a new contact by sending a POST request to the specified URL. The request should include the contact's email, full name, phone number, and an image.

### Request Body

- `email` (string, required): The email of the contact.
- `fullName` (string, required): The full name of the contact.
- `phoneNumber` (string, required): The phone number of the contact.
- `image` (string, required): The image of the contact.
    

### Response

Upon successful creation of the contact, the API will respond with the details of the newly created contact, including the contact's ID, full name, phone number, email, image, user ID, and timestamps for when the contact was created and last updated.

Example Response:

``` json
{
  "id": 0,
  "fullName": "",
  "phoneNumber": "",
  "email": "",
  "image": "",
  "UserId": 0,
  "updatedAt": "",
  "createdAt": ""
}

 ```

This endpoint allows you to update a specific contact by sending an HTTP PATCH request to the specified URL. The request should include a payload in the raw request body type to update the contact's email.

### Request Body

- email (string, required): The new email for the contact.
    

### Response

The response will include the updated details of the contact, including the contact's ID, full name, phone number, email, image, user ID, creation timestamp, and last update timestamp.

Example response:

``` json
{
    "id": 0,
    "fullName": "",
    "phoneNumber": "",
    "email": "",
    "image": "",
    "UserId": 0,
    "createdAt": "",
    "updatedAt": ""
}

 ```

This API endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to remove the contact with the ID from the server.

Upon successful deletion, the response will include a message indicating the success of the operation.

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "message": ""
}

 ```

item.description: The Product Management folder contains endpoints related to the management of contacts within the system. Contacts represent items that users can create, update, and delete.
